intro: Pithecoctenium stipulare, commonly known as the white-flowered pita, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered together, giving it a delicate appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
